Text.Page: {@LinkCreature:249#2006#Celtan} says the argons started multiplying when the {@Rgn:49003$$Agnurok Engine} appeared. You might find an answer inside.

According to Celtan, there is a huge building in the center of Argonea in the mountains that was probably built by the Argons. Before this you met with Ronalt and learned that this place is filled with life energy, so the Argons' plans could be thwarted if this place is destroyed.
You secretly entered the Cyasma Spire and destroyed the transmitter. You were then thanked for your efforts, but nobody noticed that you were being watched.

By the way, . I should let you know how things are going.

The argons started multiplying when the Agnurok Engine appeared.

Our target is the {@Rgn:49003$$Cyasma Spire}. I'm sure there's something inside.

I like how you work, .

Our scouts gave me the location ; I'll send you there. Let me know when you're ready.

Long time no see, my friend. This site might well be the most important outpost in Northern Shara.

If we're right, the energy that drives the argon war machine comes from here...and we're going to take it out. Take this reverse transducer. It should invert the energy's polarity—killing who knows how many argons."Fantastic!"
Indeed. Of course, much of our plan rests upon an untested hypothesis, but perhaps someone who's battled gods—and survived—is up to a little improvisation, eh?

I haven't thanked you yet for your help at the Melgatol Portal. I'm stronger now, largely due to your support. So, thanks. Ronalt's bold little plan requires us to infiltrate this structure. Think I'm ready?
(You feel a tingle across your skin as you approach the teleportal.)

Argh...my aching head. Nature hurts.

Watch yourself in here. The argons don't fool around. My squad barely got to the next chamber. Stick to the side passages. You might avoid fighting altogether. Take out the cyasma coils, and then use the transducer. Good luck.

We heard the argons' screams. You really hit them where it counts.

You've given us new hope, . Thank you."Glad I could help."
Hasmina wanted me to give this to you. She says you should to go to Kaiator and report this to the federation as soon as possible.
The scribes had best learn your name, my friend, because you're forging a legend every time you take the field.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I'm just doing my duty."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Come now, no false modesty. You're a damned fine soldier.

Look, I need you to head to Granarkus. The Mysterium reported new readings from what they're calling the argon queen. Imagine it. If we can take her down, we can end this war!
